;中国电子商务巨头京东否认其亿万富翁创始人刘强东的猜测强东和他的妻子章泽天已经移民美国，粉碎了有关该国最著名企业家之一个人生活的最新谣言。

;

;这家总部位于北京的公司周一在其微博帐户上写道社交媒体上流传的有关这对夫妇移居美国或花费超过1亿美元购买豪宅的八卦纯属捏造。它补充说，该公司已向中国警方报案。

;

;在该帖子所附的一封信中，代表这对夫妇的北京金诚同达律师事务所的一名律师警告说，采取法律行动任何散布“虚假信息”、“严重损害刘、张名誉”的人都将受到追究。

;

;该声明是在最高互联网监管机构中国国家互联网信息办公室的努力下发布的。消除网上有关私营企业家及其企业的错误信息，以提振私营部门的信心。

;

;中国私营企业家试图将资产转移到美国或在外国申请居留许可通常被中国网民解读为对国家不忠诚的表现。

;

;继去年有媒体报道阿里巴巴集团创始人马云已在东京生活数月后，这位退休的商业巨头也正式否认他移居日本。阿里巴巴拥有《南华早报》。

;

;没有公开证据表明刘和张在高中时因拿着一杯珍珠奶茶的照片而被称为“奶茶妹妹”该学生在网上疯传，已经移民到美国或在那里购买了房产。

;

;然而，据说张在斯坦福德住宅 (Stamford Residences) 购买了一套四卧室、五浴室的顶层公寓，这是一栋位于2015 年，距离她在澳大利亚举行婚礼的几个月前，她以 1200 万美元的价格购买了悉尼历史悠久的岩石区街区。据报道，她在 2018 年以 1600 万美元的价格卖掉了这套公寓。

;

;刘先生于 1998 年创立了京东，2018 年，明尼苏达大学的一名中国学生指控他在校期间强奸了她，这成为了头条新闻。作为学校工商管理博士项目的一部分，刘在明尼阿波利斯进行了为期一周的住院实习。

;

;刘被当地警方短暂拘留，并在获释几小时后飞回中国。当地检察官后来以缺乏证据为由决定不起诉他。该学生随后对刘提起民事诉讼，双方于去年达成和解。

;

;此后，刘与大多数其他中国科技巨头一样保持低调。

;新加坡当局周二警告总统候选人有关外国干涉和“恶意”的威胁下个月可能举行仪式性职位选举。

;

;新加坡内政部、新加坡网络安全局和选举部在给候选人的联合咨询中表示，外国行为者试图在其他地方的选举中“通过秘密和欺骗性手段操纵国内政治”。当局列举了2020年美国总统选举和2017年法国总统选举作为此类外国干预的例子。

;

;“新加坡也未能幸免。新加坡的政治应该由新加坡人自己决定。我们应该尽一切努力维护选举程序的完整性。”声明称，并补充说政府将“对外国干涉保持警惕”。

;

;当局还表示，候选人发挥了关键作用”，并建议他们监控社交媒体平台是否存在可疑活动，不要分享“来源可疑”的帖子。

;

;如果多名候选人出现，新加坡将于 9 月 1 日举行总统选举符合资格

;

;选举提名日将于8月22日举行。如果提名不止一名总统候选人竞选该职位，则该城邦的公民将于9月1日前往投票站。

;

;最近几周，四名男子——前部长，曾来自执政的人民行动党；国家投资者 GIC 前首席投资官 Ng Kok Song；业务主管乔治·吴（George Goh）；以及职总收入公司前首席执行官陈建联 – 已宣布参选。

;

;当局在声明中表示，作为“一个高度数字化的国家”，新加坡必须警惕“恶意”行为网络活动，例如“破坏、篡改或数据盗窃”。他们补充说，此类活动对选民对一些海外选举的信心产生了不利影响。

;

;新加坡媒体监管机构信息通信媒体发展局 (IMDA) 在另一份声明中表示，只有总统候选人及其候选人选举代理人可以发布付费广告，而其他人如果愿意这样做，则必须寻求书面批准。

;

;IMDA 补充说，该规则禁止外国演员在竞选期间使用这些广告作为“渠道”。

;

;政党不得支持候选人，尽管自 1993 年（无党派职位成为民选职位）以来共和国的所有总统都与执政机构有相当大的联系。

;< p>;这些声明是在关于新加坡外交政策未来的小组会议上讨论外国干涉话题的一天后发表的，前高级外交官表示，新加坡很清楚外部势力影响国内舆论的行为。

;

;新加坡总理李显龙、律政及内政部长尚穆根等新加坡最高领导人过去几年也曾在未点名任何国家的情况下就外国推断活动发出警告。

;卢卡斯影业位于新加坡的视觉效果和动画工作室将在未来几个月内关闭母公司迪士尼周二表示，由于经济原因，新加坡工作室是由工业光魔 (ILM) 在 2000 年代设立的，该公司由《星球大战》创作者乔治·卢卡斯 (George Lucas) 创立，卢卡斯影业 (Lucasfilm) 的一个部门。多年来，该公司在新加坡的总部是引人注目的 Sandcrawler 建筑，该建筑以星球大战交通工具命名，并为其设计提供了灵感。卢卡斯影业于 2021 年出售了该大楼。

;

;迪士尼在一份声明中表示：“在接下来的几个月里，ILM 将巩固其全球足迹，并由于影响该行业的经济因素而关闭其新加坡工作室。”< /p>;

;没有透露新加坡有多少员工将受到影响。

;

;据亚洲新闻频道报道，ILM 在新加坡有 340 名员工，一名员工告诉该媒体，员工将继续工作迪士尼在 2 月份表示，由于其传统电视业务受到侵蚀以及面临激烈的竞争和侵蚀，公司将在全球范围内裁员 7,000 人，这是削减成本重组的一部分其流媒体服务 Disney+ 的订户数量。

;

;新加坡信息通信媒体发展局 (IMDA) 和经济发展局表示，“卢卡斯影业决定关闭其新加坡业务是为了应对行业和商业状况的变化”董事会 (EDB) 在一份联合声明中表示。

;

;“全球媒体行业正面临技术快速进步带来的颠覆，而工作室正在应对人才和盈利能力方面的挑战。”

;

;两家政府机构表示，卢卡斯影业和相关政府机构正在帮助受影响的员工在其他公司找到职位。

;

;这家新加坡工作室参与了备受瞩目的好莱坞制作，包括《钢铁侠》、《复仇者联盟》和《星球大战》电影，根据 EDB 的网站。

;

;新加坡卢卡斯影业于 2004 年作为动画工作室开始运营。

;

;“通过在新加坡建立基地，我们可以在动画领域创造新的东西，据《洛杉矶时报》报道，卢卡斯在 2004 年表示：“这种风格融合了东西方，并提供了前所未见的东西。”

;

;卢卡斯影业和迪士尼没有立即回应置评请求。

;小米公司创始人、董事长兼首席执行官雷军周一表示，苹果 iPhone 仍然是最畅销的产品他淡化了这家中国科技公司此前提出的到 2024 年成为全球最大智能手机供应商的目标。

;

;“只有与 iPhone 对标，我们才能站稳脚跟”有一天，雷军将有机会赶上并击败它。”雷军在北京国家会议中心举行的年度演讲中多次提到苹果的旗舰设备，小米在该中心发布了最新产品。

;

;据《福布斯》报道，53 岁的雷军截至 8 月 15 日的净资产为 102 亿美元，他在长达三个小时的独角秀中分享了个人故事并重申了自己的观点，受到了约 3,500 名观众的欢呼。小米致力于在高端智能手机市场追赶苹果。

;

;“消费电子行业的竞争极其激烈，”他表示。 “瞄准高端（智能手机市场）迫使我们寻求技术突破，同时确保我们未来的发展和生存。”

;

;雷军的言论除了针对苹果之外，还反映出该公司的竞争策略中国是全球最大的智能手机市场，疫情后的经济复苏不均衡，导致消费者支出疲软。

;

;虽然中国大陆在截至 6 月份的季度出货量为 6570 万部手机，但在国内却更积极地对抗中国竞争对手。根据研究公司 IDC 的数据，2019 年 3 月 30 日，与去年同期 14.8% 的降幅相比，降幅为 2.1%，市场主要由 Oppo、Vivo、前华为技术廉价智能手机品牌荣耀和苹果主导。 .

;

;与此同时，小米在上个季度与复兴的华为并列第五位。

;

;尽管如此，总部位于北京的小米在第二季度仍排名全球第三大智能手机供应商根据 Counterpoint Research 的报告，该季度的销售额仅次于三星电子和苹果。然而，该报告指出，同期，小米在中国和印度这两个最大市场面临阻力。

;

;经常被当地媒体称为“中国的史蒂夫·乔布斯”的雷军周一表示将小米最新旗舰可折叠智能手机 Mix Fold 3 与苹果顶级 iPhone 14 Pro Max 进行比较。

;

;但雷军没有提及小米成为全球最大智能手机供应商的雄心勃勃的目标2021 年 8 月，他首次透露了这一目标，当时该公司在当年第二季度的智能手机出货量上超越苹果，仅次于三星，排名第二。

;

;虽然雷军试图将小米描绘成其主要竞争对手苹果公司截至周二的总市值为 2970.5 亿港元，与苹果公司周一的 2.82 万亿美元市值相比，相形见绌。小米将于8月29日发布第二季度财报。

;

;雷军在周一的演讲中表示，小米在智能手机高端领域的竞争经历“极其痛苦，但也富有成效”在其最初的两款高端机型小米 10 和 11 未能达到销售预期后，该市场代表了价格超过 600 美元的手机。

;

;小米新款 Mix Fold 3 起价为 8,999 元（1,240 美元） ）。该公司最新的可折叠智能手机采用高通第二代 Snapdragon 处理器，并采用与德国相机制造商徕卡联合设计的光学系统，周一活动结束后开始预订，三分钟内就售罄。

;在中国，不断增长的学业压力导致对线上新业态——虚拟学习督导陪伴。

;

;在全国最大的电商平台淘宝上，一家专门从事虚拟学习督导服务的店铺娟舞工作室，拥有超过1600名粉丝，月订单数百笔。

;

;淘宝网由《南华早报》的所有者阿里巴巴运营。

;

;以低于 20 元（2.8 美元）到 128 元的微不足道的价格，客户可以获得 10 小时的专门的在线服务，从通过视频通话在学习期间陪伴学生，到密切合作并在注意力下降时发出警告。

;

;除了一对一服务外，商店还出售门票

;

;一位购买此类门票的人表示：“在线自习室为我提供了一种单独学习的学习体验。家里就是不提供。”

;

;据店主胡学良介绍，其服务最受内地大学生欢迎，他们需要考研、考公务员等各种学习。证书使他们在激烈的就业市场中更具竞争力。

;

;16-24岁年龄段的高失业率加剧了中国教育成功的压力。在 4 月至 6 月期间创下新高后，该群体的失业率在 6 月份达到 21.3%，直到 7 月份才开始降至 20% 以下。

;

;同时，考研和报考人数也有所增加。 2023年国家公务员考试考生人数再创新高，分别为474万人和152万人。

;

;预计今年中国大学生毕业人数将达到创纪录的1158万人。

;

; >;

;胡的学习督导服务是内地火爆的众多虚拟服务之一。

;

;例如，有一项针对五（70）人之间的“骂醒相思病人”服务。美元）和 20 元人民币，这可以帮助人们走出失败的恋爱关系。

;

;其他人则通过消息应用程序提供讲笑话和“倾听”服务，以鼓舞人们并提供情感支持。

;

;另一项奇特的服务是“虚拟蚊子”，它只是通过消息应用程序用拟声词让顾客嗡嗡作响。这项售价1元的服务在淘宝上的月订阅量已超过200人。

;

;虚拟服务店老板蒋楠告诉澎湃新闻，这项业务之所以受欢迎，是因为中国年轻人越来越多。面对巨大的学习、工作和生活压力，需要一个匿名的情绪宣泄渠道。

; Tue, 15 Aug 2023 17:50:02 +0800 China and Russia pursue Eritrea for its strategic location in Africa, resources and transport potentialhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3231129/china-and-russia-pursue-eritrea-its-strategic-location-africa-resources-and-transport-potential?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.15 16:00;
;;

;China and Russia are showing growing interest in Eritrea, a small African country in a strategic location but whose president is being shunned in the West for his autocratic governance.

;

;Its geopolitical significance in the Horn of Africa and easy access to the Red Sea had attracted the attention of Beijing and Moscow, observers said, with Eritrean President Isaias Afwerki endearing his country to the big powers and earning finance for projects and investments.

;

;In 2021, Eritrea joined the Belt and Road Initiative, Beijing's multibillion-dollar programme that has helped build mega infrastructure projects – including ports, highways, power dams, railways and roads – across Africa.

;

;Chinese belt and road engagements with Eritrea rose 359 per cent in the first half of this year compared with the same period last year, according to a recent study by the Green Finance and Development Centre at the Fanhai International School of Finance, Fudan University.

;

;Christoph Nedopil Wang, director of the Fanhai green finance centre, said Chinese investments in Eritrea were related to mining, including potash, a potassium-rich salt. He cited the Sichuan Road and Bridge Group's buyout this year of Australia's Danakali Colluli potash project worth US$131 million as an example.

;

;China is currently engaged in gold and polymetallic mining in Eritrea; with most of the country's copper ore and zinc ore exported to China. In 2018, Zijin Mining Group acquired Canada's Nevsun Resources Ltd for US$1.4 billion.

;

;Chris Devonshire-Ellis, chairman of consulting firm Dezan Shira & Associates, said the jump in the first-half belt and road numbers for Eritrea came from a very small base rather than a large investment. He said the country was of strategic interest because of its long coastline, including a couple of larger ports.

;

;“These can provide regional maritime connectivity (neighbouring Sudan is another China play) as well as military naval support as the Horn of Africa is notorious for piracy,” Devonshire-Ellis said. “For both China and Russia then, Eritrea has potential – and could even become a link to the INSTC [International North–South Transport Corridor] in time.”

;

;In recent months, Isaias has met his Chinese and Russian counterparts. In May, he made a four-day state visit to China, where President Xi Jinping promised to encourage and support Chinese companies to invest in Eritrea and strengthen cooperation in infrastructure, telecommunications, agriculture, mining and fisheries. Further, Xi said China would continue sending medical teams and senior agricultural experts to Eritrea.

;

;China's Belt and Road Initiative regains momentum

;

;Also in May, Isaias made a four-day state visit to Moscow and then in July attended the Russia-Africa Summit in St Petersburg. Russian President Vladimir Putin said an ad hoc working group was “set up to look into opportunities to boost trade and step up economic cooperation between our countries”.

;

;According to Joshua Meservey, a senior fellow at the Hudson Institute who focuses on great power competition in Africa, Eritrea holds a commanding position on the Bab-el-Mandeb Strait, a global shipping choke point where Eritrean islands pepper the Red Sea approach to the strait.

;

;Seifudein Adem, an Ethiopian global affairs professor at Doshisha University in Japan, said Eritrea had become the darling of both Russia and China because of its strategic Red Sea location, one of the world's major sea routes, and proximity to Middle East oil reserves.

;

;Eritrea's access to the Red Sea, the Suez Canal and Persian Gulf waters and onwards to the Indian Ocean is important for the success of the maritime silk road, part of Xi's belt and road programme.

;

;“In a sense, Eritrea's recent flirtation with Russia and China and turning its back on the West can thus be seen as a default mode of diplomacy for Eritrea under the circumstances,” Adem said.

;

;David Shinn, a China-Africa expert and professor at George Washington University's Elliott School of International Affairs, said Western countries had generally given up on Eritrea because of its autocratic governance, military involvement in Ethiopia's Tigray region and poor human rights record.

;

;Consequently, the government in Asmara sought political and economic support wherever it could find it, said Shinn, a former US ambassador to Ethiopia. He said Eritrea was the only country in Africa to consistently take Russia's side in the Ukraine war.

;

;Shinn said China might have a long-term interest in military real estate along Eritrea's coast and be looking to increase its economic engagement throughout the Horn of Africa, although the huge rise in belt and road investment during the first half of 2023 might prove to be a short-term anomaly.

;

;Modern slavery most widespread in North Korea, Eritrea, report finds

;

;In a recent paper, Meservey said that if China developed a base – or even dual-use infrastructure – in the Eritrean port cities of Assab or Massawa to complement its base in neighbouring Djibouti, it could blockade the Bab-el-Mandeb Strait.

;

;“If a confrontation with China were to occur, such a closure would force America's Sixth Fleet to waste precious days steaming from the Mediterranean Sea around the southern tip of Africa to get to the Indian or Pacific oceans,” Meservey said.

; Tue, 15 Aug 2023 17:20:02 +0800 China’s hi-tech manufacturing reaches ‘tipping point’ amid US curbs as output growth slows to record lowhttps://www.scmp.com/economy/economic-indicators/article/3231137/chinas-hi-tech-manufacturing-reaches-tipping-point-amid-us-curbs-output-growth-slows-record-low?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.15 16:30;
;;

;Output from China's hi-tech manufacturing sector dropped in July, as analysts warned a weak position in the tech war with the United States could drag on the overall economic recovery.

;

;Beijing is eager to become more self-reliant amid Western containment efforts, but 0.7 per cent growth in July, year on year, marked the lowest pace since the monthly data started in September 2018.

;

;Hi-tech industrial output, meanwhile, rose by 1.6 per cent in the first seven months of 2023, year on year, having risen by 1.7 per cent in the first half of the year, the National Bureau of Statistics also confirmed on Tuesday.

;

;Despite slowly increasing, the year-to-date growth was still lower than the rise of 7.4 per cent at the end of 2022 and 18.2 per cent in 2021.

;

;Outside the temporary fall that resulted from the coronavirus-related disruptions in early 2020, the increase in the first seven months of the year also marked the lowest pace in nearly two decades since China first reported the data in 2003.

;

;Investment in hi-tech manufacture grew by 11.5 per cent in the first seven months of the year, also the slowest growth rate since the end of 2020.

;

;“The abrupt cliff-fall decline in hi-tech industries this year is cause for high vigilance,” said a report last month by the Renmin University of China.

;

;“It very much likely indicates that the impact of external technological blockades on China's hi-tech industries has reached a tipping point.”

;

;Beijing bets on biotech to boost China's foreign investment inflows

;

;Deflation fears, shrinking demand and weak sentiment have compounded an already faltering economic recovery, the report added.

;

;The report said that in the past two decades, the development of China's hi-tech industries have consistently been the driving force behind the stable expansion of the industrial economy, with a growth rate consistently faster than the total average industrial output.

;

;But for the first time in more than a decade, the growth rate of the hi-tech sector is consistently lower than the manufacturing sector or the total industrial output, which grew by 4.2 and 3.8 per cent, respectively, in the first seven months of the year despite a short temporary slump in early 2020.

;

;The industrial output from China's hi-tech industries from 2013 to 2022 grew at an annual average 11.2 per cent, 4.7 percentage points higher than the total industrial output, even during the coronavirus pandemic.

;

;Its growth rate remained robust at 10.9 per cent annually between 2020 and 2022, 5.6 percentage points higher than the total industrial output.

;

;Peng Peng, executive chairman of the Guangdong Society of Reform, a think tank connected to the provincial government, said that the slump is likely to continue in the next decade, and significant breakthroughs are unlikely to occur in the near future.

;

;However, “crisis means challenges and opportunities coexist,” he said.

;

;“The key lies in whether we can leverage our massive market advantage, accelerate transformation, and achieve breakthroughs in critical technologies,” said Peng.

;

;“Even if it's step by step, it's crucial to fully utilise the differentiation in Western countries and seek room for survival. After all, without the Chinese market, the West also faces losses.”

;

;Last week, Washington further escalated the tech war by imposing restrictions intended to curb US venture capital and private equity investments in Chinese companies covering semiconductors and micro electronics, quantum information technologies and certain artificial intelligence systems.

;

;The coming years would be decisive for China whether it can substantially break the US “small yard, high fence” tech restrictions, said Liu Yuanchun, president of the Shanghai University of Finance and Economics, at an economic forum on Saturday.

;

;How high will the fence be? China's grave concerns over US tech investment curbs

;

;Liu, who is also the lead author of the Renmin University report, said China must “walk on two legs” of a nationally self-reliant strategic technology system and a market-driven corporate innovation system.

;

;The report also called for fact-finding research on policies and hi-tech companies to offer effective help.

;

;The deceleration of hi-tech industries may also be one of the factors behind the rise in the unemployment rate among the young population in China, the report added.

;

;“Consequently, if not addressed promptly, both the development of China's hi-tech industry and the reservoir of hi-tech talent might undergo [negative] transformation,” the report said.

;
